anomalies.message: Absence of written-amount field (potential mismatch risk)

ai_analysis.summary: The ML ensemble indicates an extremely low fraud risk (0.0%), and the customer has a clean history with no prior escalations. The only minor concern is the missing written-amount field, but no other red flags are present.
reasoning: ML Model consensus (Random Forest 22.1%, XGBoost 23.5%) yields a combined fraud score of 0.0% with 0.0% confidence in any fraud hypothesis.
Customer has zero fraud or escalation incidents; payer-based override does not apply.
All key fields (issuer, serial number, numeric amount, date, payee/purchaser) are consistent and typical of legitimate transactions.
Only missing data point is the written amount; training data shows 45% of frauds involve amount mismatches, but here there is no conflicting numeric entry.
No similar past fraud cases in our database for this pattern or customer.
key_indicators: Absence of written-amount field (potential mismatch risk)
actionable_recommendations: Contact MoneyGram to validate serial number 9021056789 and confirm issuance details.
Ask the cashier to produce or transcribe the written-amount portion to ensure it matches the numeric value.
Check government-issued ID for Michael Lee and compare signature specimen on file.
